value: YHWH
spoke to Moses:
“Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘These are
YHWH
’s appointed times which you must proclaim as holy assemblies – my appointed times:
“‘Six days work may be done, but on the seventh day there must be a Sabbath of complete rest,
a holy assembly. You must not do any work; it is a Sabbath to
YHWH
in all the places where you live.
“‘These are
YHWH
’s appointed times, holy assemblies, which you must proclaim at their appointed time.
In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight,
is a Passover offering to
YHWH
Then on the fifteenth day of the same month
will be the festival of unleavened bread to
YHWH
; seven days you must eat unleavened bread.
On the first day there will be a holy assembly for you; you must not do any regular work.
You must present a gift to
YHWH
for seven days, and the seventh day is a holy assembly; you must not do any regular work.’”
YHWH
spoke to Moses:
“Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘When you enter the land that I am about to give to you and you gather in its harvest,
then you must bring the sheaf of the first portion of your harvest
to the priest,
and he must wave the sheaf before
YHWH
to be accepted for your benefit
– on the day after the Sabbath the priest is to wave it.
On the day you wave the sheaf you must also offer
a flawless yearling lamb
for a burnt offering to
YHWH
along with its grain offering, two tenths of an ephah of
choice wheat flour
mixed with olive oil, as a gift to
YHWH
, a soothing aroma,
and its drink offering, one fourth of a hin of wine.
You must not eat bread, roasted grain, or fresh grain until this very day,
until you bring the offering of your God. This is a perpetual statute throughout your generations
in all the places where you live.
“‘You must count for yourselves seven weeks from the day after the Sabbath, from the day you bring the wave offering sheaf; they must be complete weeks.
You must count fifty days – until the day after the seventh Sabbath – and then
you must present a new grain offering to
YHWH
From the places where you live you must bring two loaves of
bread for a wave offering; they must be made from two tenths of an ephah of fine wheat flour, baked with yeast,
as first fruits to
YHWH
Along with the loaves of bread,
you must also present seven flawless yearling lambs,
one young bull,
and two rams.
They are to be a burnt offering to
YHWH
along with their grain offering
and drink offerings, a gift of a soothing aroma to
YHWH
You must also offer
one male goat
for a sin offering and two yearling lambs for a peace offering sacrifice,
and the priest is to wave them – the two lambs
– along with the bread of the first fruits, as a wave offering before
YHWH
; they will be holy to
YHWH
for the priest.
“‘On this very day you must proclaim an assembly; it is to be a holy assembly for you.
You must not do any regular work. This is a perpetual statute in all the places where you live throughout your generations.
When you gather in the harvest
of your land, you must not completely harvest the corner of your field,
and you must not gather up the gleanings of your harvest. You must leave them for the poor and the foreigner. I am
YHWH
your God.’”
YHWH
spoke to Moses:
“Tell the Israelites, ‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you must have a complete rest, a memorial announced by loud horn blasts,
a holy assembly.
You must not do any regular work, but
you must present a gift to
YHWH
YHWH
spoke to Moses:
“The
tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement.
It is to be a holy assembly for you, and you must humble yourselves
and present a gift to
YHWH
You must not do any work on this particular day,
because it is a day of atonement to make atonement for yourselves
before
YHWH
your God.
Indeed,
any person who does not behave with humility on this particular day will be cut off from his people.
As for any person
who does any work on this particular day, I will exterminate
that person from the midst of his people!
You must not do any work. This is a perpetual statute throughout your generations
in all the places where you live.
It is a Sabbath of complete rest for you, and you must humble yourselves on the ninth day of the month in the evening, from evening until evening you must observe your Sabbath.”
YHWH
spoke to Moses:
“Tell the Israelites, ‘On the fifteenth day of this seventh month is the Festival of Temporary Shelters
for seven days to
YHWH
On the first day is a holy assembly; you must do no regular work.
For seven days you must present a gift to
YHWH
. On the eighth day there is to be a holy assembly for you, and you must present a gift to
YHWH
. It is a solemn assembly day;
you must not do any regular work.
“‘These are the appointed times of
YHWH
that you must proclaim as holy assemblies to present a gift to
YHWH
– burnt offering, grain offering, sacrifice, and drink offerings,
each day according to its regulation,
besides
the Sabbaths of
YHWH
and all your gifts, votive offerings, and freewill offerings which you must give to
YHWH
“‘On
the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you gather in the produce of the land, you must celebrate a pilgrim festival of
YHWH
for seven days. On the first day is a complete rest and on the eighth day is complete rest.
On the first day you must take for yourselves branches from majestic trees
– palm branches, branches of leafy trees, and willows of the brook – and you must rejoice before
YHWH
your God for seven days.
You must celebrate it as a pilgrim festival to
YHWH
for seven days in the year. This is a perpetual statute throughout your generations;
you must celebrate it in the seventh month.
You must live in temporary shelters
for seven days; every native citizen in Israel must live in temporary shelters,
so that your future generations may know that I made the Israelites live in temporary shelters when I brought them out from the land of Egypt. I am
YHWH
your God.’”
So Moses spoke to the Israelites about the appointed times of
YHWH
